title: Calories in Homemade Chili
meta_description: Discover calories in homemade chili per serving, including macros like protein, carbs, fat, plus recipe tweaks and nutrition basis for easy tracking.
assumptions: Standard beef and bean chili with ground beef (lean), kidney beans, tomatoes, onions, garlic, chili powder; 1 cup serving (~240 g), no toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, meat fat content, bean type, added oils, and portion size. Check ingredients for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One cup of homemade chili provides ~286 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for comparison.

tweaks.label: Vegetarian version (replace beef with more beans)
Use ground turkey instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of homemade chili?
faqs.a: Approximately 286 kcal for a standard beef and bean recipe.

faqs.q: What's the protein in homemade chili?
faqs.a: About 20 g protein per cup, mainly from beef and beans.

faqs.q: Does homemade chili have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 800 mg per cup due to canned tomatoes and spices; use low-sodium versions to reduce.

faqs.q: How do carbs break down in homemade chili?
faqs.a: 25 g total carbs per cup, with 7 g fiber and 5 g sugars from beans and tomatoes.

faqs.q: Can I make homemade chili lower in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, use leaner meat or turkey, drain fat after browning, and skip added oils to cut ~4 g fat per cup.
